Reserve.definition: to keep back or set apart

re·serv·ing.definition: to keep back or set apart

sub_terms.a: to keep (a right, power, or interest) esp. by express declaration [all rights] compare
sub_terms.b: to defer a determination of (a question of law) [the justicesthe question because it was not an issue in the case]n

re·serv·ing.reserved: the question because it was not an issue in the case]

1.definition: a reserve allocated by a bank for the purpose of absorbing losses [a loan]

2.definition: an insurance company's reserve representing the discounted value of future payments to be made on losses which may have already occurred

3.definition: money kept in a separate account to meet future liabilities

legal reserve.definition: the minimum amount as determined by government standards of the deposits held by a bank or of the assets of a life insurance company required by law to be kept as reserves

policy reserve.definition: an insurance company's reserve representing the difference in value between the net premiums and assumed claims for a given year in life insurance

unearned premium reserve.definition: a reserve of funds which represents premiums paid to an insurance company but not yet applied to policy coverage and from which a policyholder is paid a refund in the event of cancellation prior to the period for which premiums have been paid
